coverage.graph
Class Graph

java.lang.Object
  coverage.graph.GraphBase
      coverage.graph.Graph
Direct Known Subclasses:
DFGraph
public class Graph
extends GraphBase

Three graph properties must be satisfied for computing coverage:

  • one initial node and at least one ending node.
  • exsit a path from the inital node to any node
  • exist an path from any node to at least one of the ending nodes.
    The last two properties also called in the class 'connected' * @author Wuzhi Xu, Date: Dec 12, 2006 Modified by Nan Li

    findTestPath

    public java.util.List<Path> findTestPath()
                                  throws InvalidGraphException
    After generating the spanning tree for graph. This method extends the paths in the spanning tree to the paths having ending nodes.

    Returns:
    Throws:
    InvalidGraphException - if the graph is invalid, or there is a dead loop

    findSpanningTree

    public java.util.List<Path> findSpanningTree()
                                      throws InvalidGraphException
    Create the spanning tree for a graph. The tree is represented by a list of paths that start from the initial nodes

    Returns:
    a list of paths starting from each initial node and all nodes have been reached in a graph
    Throws:
    InvalidGraphException

    findNodeCoverage

    public java.util.List<Path> findNodeCoverage()
                                      throws InvalidGraphException
    Goal:Find a minimal set of test paths for node coverage using detours Actually it is really hard to achieve it. For instance: we have paths from findTestPath() p1: [0,1,2,3,1,5,6] p2: [0,1,5,6] p3: [0,4,4,6] p4: [0,4,6] The minimal set of test paths for node coverage should be p1 and p4 However, using touring with detours, we get p1 and p3

    Throws:
    InvalidGraphException

    validate

    public void validate()
              throws InvalidGraphException
    A valid graph must have the following three properties :
  • at least one initial node and at least one final node
  • exist a path for any node that can be reached by the initial node(connected)
  • exist a path for any node that can reach at least one ending node(dead loop) This method check the first and second properties.

    Specified by:
    validate in class GraphBase
    Throws:
    InvalidGraphException
